attributes.action: Condemn the Bangladeshi Government's violent crackdown on student protests.
attributes.background: The protests demanding more stringent road safety, were triggered when 2 students were killed by a speeding bus.The student-led protests are being targeted by state-sponsored violence. Bangladesh's government has also shut down access to mobile internet in many parts of the country in response.
attributes.additional_details:
The Telegraph and the BBC have noted the use of rubber bullets by the police. Online evidence, being shared by the protesters, also point to sexual assault and violent attacks carried out by the student wing of the ruling party, Awami League and the authorities.
Per the WHO, there are 20,000 road fatalities every year in Bangladesh. The government's violent crackdown is thought to be fueled by fears of anti-government sentiments leading up to the general election.

attributes.action: Reduce the eligibility of Police long service medal from 20 to 15 years
attributes.background:
Emergency services especially in current times face dangers day in and day out. But have to wait 5 years longer for any formal recognition.
It is proposed that the long service medal of both the police and fire service should be reduced from 20 years to 15 years exactly like the armed forces.

attributes.action: Allow the public to decide by referendum on any Brexit 'no deal' not Parliament
attributes.background:
The public voted to leave the EU to be better off.
A 'no deal' Brexit will result in the UK being substantially worse off.
The final decision to accept a no deal Brexit  it is so fundamental to the future of the UK that it should be made or rejected by the British people.
attributes.additional_details:
The referendum will allow the public the opportunity to take the decision for the UK based the facts of a no deal.
A no deal Brexit has profound implications for the future way of life for the people of the United Kingdom.
The confidence held by the UK in its members of Parliament will be enhanced by being allowed to take this final decision by referendum. Equally, should Parliament take the decision the potential public anger at being worse off could cause public unrest and further division.

attributes.action: Government to amend rules so GPs can charge Solicitors for postage for SAR.
attributes.background: GDPR has put a financial burden of £25 for postage on GP Practices for Subject Access Requests (SAR) for litigation cases from Solicitors. Solicitors are capitalising on this as opposed to requesting Access To Medical Records which carries a fee. GP time to remove sensitive data is not recoverable.
attributes.additional_details:
Historically practices could charge up to £50.00 to cover the consumables and postage charges. 
Solicitors are requesting information under a SAR request despite it clearly being for litigation. Patients are consenting to full medical records which under data protection is excessive in line with the Caldecott principals.

attributes.action: Extend paternity leave to at least 4 weeks so fathers can bond with their child.
attributes.background: Being a father and being there for your new born baby is so important at the early stages of life, to bond and make that connect this needs to happen early on in a baby's life, also helping your partner out with the night and day duties taking some of that pressure off the mother.
attributes.additional_details: How can men and women truly be treated equally if the father only get 1-2 week paternity leave and the mother gets up 26 weeks with full pay and 26 weeks additional weeks half pay depending on the company. This is such a serious matter and should be looked into carefully in the best interest of the baby and parents no matter the sex.

attributes.action: The government should require all rail companies to offer part season tickets.
attributes.background: Rail prices continually increase year on year out of line with wage increases. Those working part time are forced to make a choice between accepting sky high day fares or buying season tickets which do not offer good value for money. Women and carers are disproportionately affected.

attributes.action: Employers to allow employees paid time off to attend NHS blood donation
attributes.background: I recently asked to leave work for an hour to attend a local blood donation session and was declined it from a large employer. Allow staff time of work on proof of donation letter to attend local blood donation sessions to help save lives

attributes.action: Social workers or Cafcass should have to record meetings with parents/children.
attributes.background: Currently caseworkers can deny making inappropriate comments, and there’s no way to uphold a complaint as a result. Requiring these meeting to be recorded will provide accurate evidence against the caseworker and likewise the caseworker would be supported if a vexatious case was made against them.
attributes.additional_details: Most importantly, this will help ensure that correct decisions are made about the care of our children.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 13!!!
attributes.background: Teenagers should be allowed the right to vote. They are old enough to understand current world affairs and still young enough to be affected by it later on in their lives. They should be able to have a voice and decide their own future.

attributes.action: Raise parent earning limit from individual to joint to enable equal childcare
attributes.background:
Government will provide 30hours a week free childcare. 1 condition is if an individual earns <£100k. 2 parents both earning <£100k can far exceed the gross income of a family where only 1 individual earns £100k+ e.g. £95k+£60k.

Petition is to enable £200k joint before family no longer qualifies.
attributes.additional_details:
Family A 
- Parent 1 £99k 
- Parent 2 £99k 
- Total = £198k 
- Household allowed 30 hours free child care

Family B 
- Parent 1 £101k 
- Parent 2 £15k 
- Total = £116k 
- Household is NOT entitled to free childcare (despite gross income £82k less!)
- Petition to ALLOW this type of scenario to qualify for free child care

This petition will enable Family B parent 2 to increase working hours by accessing equal childcare funding.

attributes.action: New high speed rail link parkway station for Maidstone
attributes.background: The HS1 link bypasses Maidstone and the town is at a disadvantage to other Kent towns in investment and travel provision. A new parkway station could be accessed from the A229 and would serve both Maidstone and the surrounding towns. There should have been a station when it was first developed.
attributes.additional_details: The HS1 high speed rail line runs north of Maidstone, providing faster travel links to Ebbslfeet and Ashford as well as towns further away such as Canterbury and Margate, but the County Town receives no benefit. Investment in Ashford and Ebbsfleet is significantly greater than Maidstone and the town still suffers from a poor and very slow train service to London compared to other towns outside of London. It takes twice as long to reach London from Maidstone than from Ashford which is ridiculous.

attributes.action: Ban alcohol and gambling sponsors in sport.
attributes.background:
Our nation is getting worse with alcohol and gambling, young children, teens are being exposed to bad influences that it is good to drink alcohol and gamble as it is good to watch sport such as football. Children are seeing this as a norm and have become addicts.
It is time to stop this.

attributes.action: Dissolve the Northern Ireland Assembly with immediate effect
attributes.background:
The Northern Ireland Assembly has failed all of the people of Northern Ireland.
As a direct consequence of MLA’s refusing to take their seats within the Government the country is failing.
The people have a right to have direction and leadership which the current Assembly is not providing.

attributes.action: Add "None of the above" to the election ballot paper.
attributes.background: With belief in MP's of all parties at an all time low, add "None of the above" to the ballot paper to remove all candidates in a constituency from standing in elections for 10 years. this may make candidates, MP's and parties more respectful and responsive to the electorate in their constituencies.
attributes.additional_details: If "None of the above" wins the ballot then all those candidate on the ballot paper would be barred from standing for office for 10 years

attributes.action: Provide armed security for the Orthodox Jewish Community in the UK
attributes.background: European governments are providing armed security for synagogues and Jewish institutions following numerous fatal terror attacks. This is because where there is a serious risk of fatalities, the only feasible solution is to provide armed security for Jewish public places. The UK must do the same.
attributes.additional_details:
The Terror threat level in Europe is getting worse, with innocent people of all races being murdered. The threat to the Jewish community is always greater, in particular when elements of the media promote anti-semitic perspectives on the Middle East conflict. The Gov't Provides armed Police for Foreign embassies and must do the same for it's own citizens who need it.

It is impossible for a policeman or security guard without a weapon to protect sites from  terrorists armed with weapons.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of confectionery at the checkout in all UK shops
attributes.background: The UK is facing a huge obesity crisis, which is placing increasing pressure on the NHS. This petition calls for a ban on the sale of confectionery at the checkout in all UK shops (excluding confectionery shops) to stop consumers impulse buying confectionery they would otherwise not have bought.
attributes.additional_details:
The obesity crisis that the UK is facing is unprecedented. To tackle this issue, more preventative measures ought to be taken. This petition offers such an idea. A simple idea, but one that can make a difference.
References: 
BBC programme - Britain's Fat Fight with Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall
Article: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-43838655
NHS on obesity: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/obesity/
Find out your BMI: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-43697948
See also NHS Digital UK obesity stats.

attributes.action: Grants for wash/dry toilets installed in households. Stop use of wipes/tissue.
attributes.background: There is currently a lot  in the media about how harmful the use of toilet wipes is on the environment and marine life. It is also costly to clear up and provide necessary protection. Providing access to grant aided/discounted wash and dry toilets should help to greatly minimise this. SaveOurPlanet!

attributes.action: Demand a pay cut of £13,612 of all MLAs in Northern Ireland
attributes.background: There has been deadlock in Stormont with key players obstructing negotiations since the assembly collapse. Public services are suffering due to the collapse while public servants receive full pay. This is unreasonable!
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-northern-ireland-42418944
I z http://www.itv.com/news/utv/2018-03-13/bradley-rejects-claims-of-dithering-over-mla-pay/

attributes.action: Ban all plastics and other non-recyclables from Christmas Crackers
attributes.background: The items in Christmas Crackers are often single use. The plastic "toys" contained in cheaper Christmas Crackers are often of inferior quality, non-functional and often thrown away on the same day they are produced. Minimum standards for Christmas Crackers should be defined to reduce waste.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to have alcohol at school events in which children are present.
attributes.background: Alcohol plays far too big a part in society as it is. Alcohol is a grown up thing that children should not be part of. By having alcohol at children's school events we are not only weakening the safeguarding of the children attending, but also showing them that we drink to have a good time.
attributes.additional_details:
Adults should be leading by good example. You can't teach responsible drinking while drinking in front of them. It should be respected that there are parents that want to raise their children in alcohol free environments. 
1 in 5 children are affected by a parents drinking this also needs to be taken into consideration, for some of those children school is a safe and fun environment. 
There is no argument for alcohol at schools, other than "we want it" However there are many disadvantages to it.

attributes.action: Make a law on age for babysitting and being left home alone
attributes.background: As confusing as it is some people think it's wrong to let teenagers under 16 look after their siblings or other young children, whilst others see no harm As it can be good to trust these days and at other times there are risks..
attributes.additional_details:
Do we educate our children how to deal with emergencies when they arise or how to cook their own food without setting fire to the kitchen.
Just think a law should be in place to protect not only the children but others around and make it a legal age to babysit

attributes.action: Expand the Ancestry Visa to Commonwealth Citizens w/ UK born great grandparents
attributes.background: Currently, the Home Office only allows for Commonwealth Citizens who have at least one UK born grandparent to obtain an ancestry visa. We want to change this and extend this visa to Commonwealth Citizens who have at least one UK born great-grandparent.
attributes.additional_details: Many of us have cousins spread across the Commonwealth who still maintain close family connections with us despite the fact that they have been out of the UK for a few generations. If they wish to return to our island, then we should allow them to do so. In addition most of them have a great understanding of our political system and culture, as well conform to our standards. An act such as this will put us in a better position with the Commonwealth and help fill the Brexit labour shortage.

attributes.action: Stop giving taxpayers' money to the National Union of Students (NUS).
attributes.background:
NUS is a political organisation not a union and thus must not be given taxpayers money. 
 
http://mallarduk.com/as-a-student-the-nus-continues-to-embarrass-me%E2%94%82-matt-gillow

attributes.action: Minimum 5 year sentence for possession of Offensive Weapons in a public place.
attributes.background: The current sentencing tariffs are insufficient and ineffective as a deterrent. On first offence, a minimum sentence of 6 months custody which may be suspended for 5 years, depending on specific circumstance. On second offence, a minimum sentence of 5 years custody, with no option of early release.
attributes.additional_details:
Current CPS sentencing guidance for 16-17 year olds, is set to 4 months minimum detention and a training order, in the worst scenarios: ( https://www.cps.gov.uk/legal-guidance/offensive-weapons-knives-bladed-and-pointed-articles ) Clearly, this is not a deterrent.
The proposed tariffs would apply to all ages. To ensure the new tariffs are clear, a campaign to publicise them to the target audience (10 years old and above suggested) should be conducted through National & local media.

attributes.action: Give a bursary to those people wanting to train to teach drama
attributes.background: “Acting is behaving truthfully under imaginary circumstances.” - Sanford Meisner. Drama is a subject where students are creative, present in the moment and help them to understand their existence, both physically and emotionally. Teacher training is funded for several other subjects - why not drama?

attributes.action: Urge Thameslink not to makes changes to timetable
attributes.background: Thameslink are planning in May to change the timetables which will mean that commuters will be delayed with for work etc

attributes.action: Ban the use of high-frequency sonic deterrents against young people
attributes.background:
'Mosquitos' are devices deployed outside shops in public areas, with the aim of deterring loitering. They output high-energy 17400Hz waves, only heard by children and young adults.

This 108-decibel assault is painful, causes headaches, and discriminates against all young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Mosquito use infringes on section 14 (discrimination) of the European Convention on Human Rights and the Human Rights Act 1998. The Council of Europe has recommended in 2010 that it be banned.

Mosquito emissions are irritating, painful, and have been compared to forms of torture.

Kent County Council have already banned these on council-owned buildings - why are the Government not at least doing the same?

attributes.action: Improve mental healthcare provisions available for prisoners
attributes.background: Levels of mental health conditions amongst prisoners are disproportionately high compared to those in society.  Despite this, provisions available for prisoners are lacking and the prison environment itself can be a driving force which exacerbates a mental health condition opposed to combatting it.
attributes.additional_details:
90% of prisoners experience some form of mental health condition whilst in prison (Singleton et al., 1998) and acute disorders such as psychosis are extremely high (Bebbington et al., 2016).  Suicide and self harm rates are at an all time high (Fazel et al., 2017).
Whilst HMPPS and the NHS alongside the department of health provide "in reach teams" to help those suffering from a mental health condition, more needs to be done.

attributes.action: Increase armed forces budget
attributes.background: We believe that the armed forces are receiving too little in budget and pay. and we believe that they should get more money due to the fact that everyday their life is put on the line.

attributes.action: All EU powers should return to Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland after Brexit
attributes.background: The UK government is saying that they need to reserve some powers after Brexit to protect the UK single market.  But that’s not necessarily true.  What they’re proposing would actually damage the UK and the UK single market.  So I call on the UK to automatically devolve all of these EU powers.
attributes.additional_details: Devolving all these powers would might prevent the break up of the UK.  Whereas, what the UK government is proposing would actually break Britain up.  So I would like to see a cross-party discussion on this.

attributes.action: Let contraceptives be sold over-the-counter
attributes.background: Contraceptives are currently not sold over-the-counter, you have to get a prescription for one. I believe that this should change. Many people require contraceptive pills and other forms of contraception for different reasons, and they have to go through too much hassle. Make pills over the counter!
attributes.additional_details: People need contraceptives. Women and men - regardless of sexuality - need them to stop STIs and unplanned pregnancies. Transgender men who aren't on HRT can use them to stop their periods, and they may have a judgmental family who would treat them harshly if they found out this was why they were getting contraception - especially 13-to-16-year-olds. Making contraceptives over-the-counter will benefit so many people in terms of health and confidentiality, so what are we waiting for?

attributes.action: Legally binding target to give men and women equal life expectancy.
attributes.background: End the worst gender inequality of them all - refocus health resources to give men and women equal life expectancy. The ONS states that the average life expectancy is 79 years for men and 83 years for women. This is a shocking discrimination against men, in the most fundamental way - life itself.
attributes.additional_details: The government should re-direct NHS resources to close the 4-year gap. No child should be born to a shorter life simply by being born male. Medical opinion is that there is no basic reason why women should live longer than men - so resources in research, treatment, health education etc. should be focused on men's health until the gap is closed.

attributes.action: Stop asking schools to check the right to work for parents on school visits
attributes.background: Parents accompanying off site visits with schools are classed as volunteers. All workers voluntary or otherwise must have their right to work checked. This requirement for checks involves schools taking a copy of a passport and signing and dating to say it represents the parent.
attributes.additional_details: I am Headteacher in a busy primary school and neither I nor my office staff have time for unnecessary work. This requirement to check adds an additional admin burden for people who in goodwill are supporting the work of the school on a casual and irregular basis. Accompanying off site visits does not constitute work and will not lead to employment. Parents of children who attend a state funded school must have the right to work and residence or their children will not get a place in school.

attributes.action: Make snow days a compulsory paid day off
attributes.background: We are asking the government to make snow days a compulsory paid day off we ask that under a amber warning for snow that if you cannot get into work or the company that you work for does not trade that we are paid for it

attributes.action: Debate the protection of vulnerable people from excessive insurance renewals
attributes.background:
The government needs to protect elderly and vulnerable people who are unable to look for and change to more competitive deals with alternative insurance providers for home insurance.

Which may result in the elderly person and property not being insured as the excessive cost is prohibitive
attributes.additional_details: I have personal experience of a number of elderly persons receiving excessive home insurance renewal premiums which were five times market rate. This is due to the insurance company's understanding that the elderly could be without internet access or otherwise isolated and would find it difficult or indeed impossible to move to cheaper alternative providers - and therefore incumbent insurance companies inflate renewals and any subsequent offers as there is no independent oversight available.

attributes.action: Ban nudity on social media
attributes.background: Nudity has a negative affect on society, and vulnerable individuals are pressured into posting provocative images online which will stay there forever. Naked pictures online causes harm to future generations, because children may feel ‘not good enough’ when compared to the images online.
attributes.additional_details: Instagram and YouTube are full of inappropriate material that shouldn’t be uploaded in the first place.

attributes.action: HMG to advise Her Majesty to remove “Royal” from Borough of Kensington & Chelsea
attributes.background: On the Prime Minister’s advice, Wootton Basset was awarded the title “Royal” as a result of it's dedicated action. If this honour can be awarded it can also be removed. This should apply to Kensington and Chelsea as a result of the action prior to and inaction following the Grenfell Tower tragedy.
attributes.additional_details: It is an affront to British values for Kensington and Chelsea to continue to use the title “Royal”. The council leader has resigned. Responsibility for Grenfell Tower residents has been taken away from the council by HM Government. A public inquiry has been ordered by HM Government.

attributes.action: Legally enforce an opt-out solution for paper publications sent by organisations
attributes.background: Universities, schools, and professional bodies frequently post paper journals and other publications to their members. These are usually unsolicited, and often thrown away unread. In the era of online technology, they are a waste of public and private money, and needlessly damage the environment.
attributes.additional_details: It would be very simple to create a central website (one could be built at very little expense), to which these large organisations must have a log in.  Individuals could then record their wish to unsubscribe from monthly paper publications (by organisation): expressing their mailing frequency preference, or requesting online issues instead.  The government should compel these organisations to have a membership to this system, and to respect the preferences of those receiving these publications.

attributes.action: Start a Parliamentary debate over funding of the UK's crumbling road network
attributes.background: The UK is the 9th richest country in the world by GDP however a recent survey of the standard of its road network placed it 27th behind such countries as Namibia and Ecuador. The problems represent chronic under investment in crucial infrastructure.
attributes.additional_details:
Studies have shown patching up roads to be 10 times more expensive in the long run than resurfacing entire stretches.

Please sign this petition if you too have had enough and think it is time the funding of road maintenance was subject to a serious debate in Parliament in attempt to bring the road network of the UK to a standard where it is actually fit for purpose rather than the national embarrassment, safety hazard to road users and barrier to economic growth that it currently is.

attributes.action: Make the sale of Cannabis Seeds Illegal in the UK
attributes.background: It may surprise you that while it is illegal to have anything to do with Cannabis,it is fine to sell Cannabis Seeds.This may seem to you to be"Asking for trouble"and"Clearly stupid, contradictory & sending a mixed message".This is a loophole that allows cultivation to Start and allows gangs to form.
attributes.additional_details: Cannabis causes mental illness and disrupts educational progression. If as a Society we are opposed to it, we should be opposed to it all the way and not leave loopholes open so that "Head Shops" can sell cannabis seeds under the ludicrous pretext that they are doing it for sentimental reasons or for "genetic storage". This is a barefaced lie that puts the health of the Nation at risk.

attributes.action: Full-time employees to receive £100 bonus a month if they have no sickness
attributes.background: People who work full time, pay bills, have no help and have little left per month should be rewarded with a £100 incentive. This would make people working full time feel appreciated. The Government are helping the wrong people and its time for full-time workers to have a reward.

attributes.action: No transfer of powers to councils to fine motorists for minor traffic offences
attributes.background: Town halls want to rake in more cash by securing sweeping new powers to impose fines on motorists for minor traffic offences.  The Local Government Association want government to transfer powers to them that are currently only available to the police.
attributes.additional_details: The Local Government Association have already started the process of lobbying government in the form of the Department of Transport.  They believe that they are better suited to this enforcement than the police.  This has already been rejected once, but they are continuing to put pressure on government for the change.  We already know that local government isn't about making things safer it's purely a revenue raising exercise and again the motorist is yet again being seen as a cash cow.

attributes.action: Redirect funds gained from taxing 'Legal Highs' to Safe Housing & Rehab Centres
attributes.background:
Formally Legal highs started out as a legal recreational drug, found in many shops in the UK and often seen in use in festivals. 
Fast forward 10 years and the now illegal  psychoactive substances leave addicts with side effects, paranoia, coma, seizures and death with no specialised support.
attributes.additional_details: Prior to the new legislation ( The Psychoactive Substances Act May 2016)  ' legal high' was the title given to  substances sold that emulated illegal drugs such as cocaine,heroin, speed, cannabis. It could be found sold in shops/festivals/online. Since the Ban was enforced these psychoactive drugs have been forced underground and are now even more dangerous. I suggest that any taxes gathered from the years that the drug was 'legal ' should be redirected in specific rehab and homeless centres.

attributes.action: Make all school "Keep Clear" markings mandatory zones instead of advisory.
attributes.background: Too many people ignore the Keep Clear markings around school entrances as currently they are advisory unless accompanied by signage and enforced by the local Councils. Making them compulsory No Parking zones would make school entrances safer for all.

attributes.action: Require ride-sharing services to give drivers equity to operate in the UK
attributes.background: To get a license to operate in the UK, all "gig economy" types of companies such as Uber, Gett, Deliveroo, etc. would be required to designate a pool of equity (or cash from its sale) to its workers. This would be distributed on a negotiated per mile/hour basis + a 'time on network' + rating policy.
attributes.additional_details:
Protect Intelligent Systems Workers

Any worker who contributes to an intelligent network, AI or algorithm that will put their long-term work at risk should participate in the long-term equity success of that network or system because they are helping to build it.

The government should make this equity grant a requirement of entry into any city or town and should hold in escrow either equity, funds or both to protect the longterm future of these intelligent systems workers. 

www.found.ee/taxi

attributes.action: Install a fence or screen in the middle of motorways to prevent rubber necking
attributes.background: Rubber necking creates massive amounts of traffic even on a road that is totally unaffected. For example, an accident on the opposite carriage can cause a queue or a crash due to people looking across the road instead of where they're going. We need to install screens or barriers to prevent this!

attributes.action: Equal rights for boys up to their 18th birthday to receive the HPV vaccine.
attributes.background: Today 24/7/18, the government announced that boys aged 12-13 will receive the HPV vaccine from 2019. While this is great news,   I would like to petition the government to increase the age limit to the same that is offered to girls, up to their 18th birthday.
attributes.additional_details:
A jab that protects against a virus that causes cervical cancer will be given to boys aged 12 to 13 in England. 
The policy decision brings England into line with Scotland and Wales. 
HPV vaccine is already routinely offered to girls of the same age at secondary school and is free up until they turn 18.
Experts and campaigners have been calling for equal access to the jab, which can also guard against oral, throat and anal cancers.

attributes.action: Introduce law to fine or prosecute the parents of bullies
attributes.background: Bullies have always been a problem in all schools. No action takes place because of their age, therefore they continue to bully. Parents are threatened with fines or prosecution for their child to take too much time off school, surely parents should face the same threat for their child to bully.
attributes.additional_details: Cyber bullying, bullying, threats and ABH, suicide, low self esteem. If parents get fined or threatened with prosecution each time their child bullies another, bullying will become easier to deal with. No child wants their parents to be in trouble, I think this will make the parents more inclined to help stop their child’s bullying behaviour or get help with antibullying classes. Justice for the victims of school bullying. No child deserves to be hurt physically or mentally by their peers.

attributes.action: All foods that contain gelatine must state what type of animal it is made from
attributes.background: I would like this to happen as many religions have certain foods that they are not allowed to eat.
attributes.additional_details:
Reading the ingredients on the back of food to check and it just says gelatine is not helpful. This petition is simple and wants companies to be required to specify what animal gelatine is in their products.

I really hope we can do this as a United Kingdom and bring together at least 10,000 signatures so we can get a written response from the Government!

attributes.action: Lower the tax on alcohol sold in pubs and clubs
attributes.background: Once the local pub or club was the centre of a community, people met their future spouses, discussed their problems and received help, made friends and built a network of support encouraging a communal spirit and mental well-being. Cheap alcohol consumption from an off licence fosters non of this.
attributes.additional_details: There is a rising level of mental health issues / youth disorders I believe can be linked to the lose of community spirit. Clubs and pubs can form a focal point of this along side health and fitness centers, recreational clubs and community centers.  The tax on alcohol should be lowered in pubs / clubs to encourage people to get out and socialize rather than consume alcohol at home from off licence premises.
